comment: shes a good sociology teacher but the quizzes and tests have the worst grading key i have ever seen. Youll have questions that have the answer literally word for word and itll still be wrong and counted against you. No lockdown, but your notes and the textbook will not save you. I genuinely don't know if she will fix this for future classes or not

The class was all around okay but nothing spectacular that makes her stand out like many teachers in the sociology and criminology fields. Can't recommend for those who actually want clear instructions and full detail of what she wants in terms of papers but everything else is easy. Just overall, meh.

I do not understand how this professor has such a good rating. She was TERRIBLE. Quizzes are nothing like the readings and she will not let you know what you got wrong so you have no way of making corrections or understanding the material. Be prepared to read close to 100 pages a week just in her class.
This class was fairly easy but due to the grading scale you should do good on the test if you are trying to make an A. They are equally weighted with discussions and quizzes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very caring teacher and its very knowledgeable and passionate. Her tests can be difficult but if you study you should be fine. She does give you a very thorough study guide but also tries her best to help her students. I honestly am a slacker and I enjoyed her. Her lectures can be boring and if you don't like to study then don't take her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Great class. Great teacher. Very interesting material.

Dr. Sterling is by far one of the best if not THE BEST professor I ever had at KSU. She is very knowledgeable & passionate about sociology and that makes the class interesting in fun. Classes are powerpoint heavy but she is very interactive. She cares about her students & seeing you succeed. Communicate with her and you shouldn't any have problems.

Fairly easy course, just make sure you come to class and read the chapters and you will do fine. Tests are short answer but as long as you read the sections, you'll be fine. Her lectures are straight from the power points but she makes them interesting. One lit review at the end of the semester. Would def take her again, she's so sweet.

Great teacher, it's not an extremely difficult class, but you do have to work for your grade. You will do discussion post for each sections with 2 replies and quizzes. There were 3 papers and a couple assignments. You have more than enough time to complete, just make sure you stay on top of the schedule.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Lots of discussion modules and short essay questions but the material was interesting which helps.  I enjoyed this online course.  Would take Prof. Sterling again.

This is the first and only professor I would go to an 8AM class for. Her lectures are very interesting and participation helps you learn, so participate in the discussions! She has three tests, and if you make an A on all of them, you're good, because the final exam is optional. Otherwise, make sure you go to the review session!
Professor Sterling was always in a great mood, she taught straight from her powerpoints but everything was easily remembered and thorough.  Attendance isn't important, however it definitely helps.

Love the teacher! She was very helpful, but she made it clear that if you didn't try in the class you would find it hard to pass. As long as you show up for class you will be fine! She uploads her powerpoints, but most of her information she talks about in her lectures so be careful. Only 3 tests, but the final is optional.

Best online class. Weekly discussion post & quizzes. 3 test. 1 paper. Although this was my second time taking a class with her this was my FIRST time taking an online class. VERY helpful, & EASY grade. As long as you keep up with the assignments you will do good.

Dr. Sterling knew the material very well and was always prepared for lectures.  She would break lectures up with short youtube videos and class discussion.  The assignments and grading were very clear. Great upper level elective.  I enjoyed The Gerontology class very much and I learned a lot.
Very straightforward class taught by a great teacher! Super nice and approachable. Open note reading quizzes for easy grades. drops the lowest one. Test are all multiple choice.
This was an awesome class taught by an awesome teacher!

Dr. Sterling is a very nice teacher. I took her in person and the class was very interactive. Sterling answers questions with clarity and brings in guest speakers. Powerpoints are detailed, tests have 25 multiple choice and 10 free answer questions. Grading rubric is very clear so just follow the instructions and you will get a good paper grade.

Professor is extremely nice, but she is not a good professor. She does not command attention and your mind will drift during the lecture. The subject matter did not interest me, but I know for a fact there were sociology majors in there that hated the class too. Nothing is too difficult, just look at book's definitions for safety.

She is very knowledgeable and encourages class participation.  She will listen to every story you have.  Really nice.  Tests are not hard, but you have to study and understand the material.  I would take her again, but I am graduating this semester!!!
All she does is read off PowerPoints and is very boring. Do not expect to get your test back in a timely manner, she will take 2+ weeks to grade a multiple choice test. I would not take her again.

Dr. Sterling is incredibly sweet. She is very willing to help and always asks for class feedback. She is very knowledgeable about the material she lectures on and asks questions that make you look at things differently. There is reading but if you're taking a 30004000 college course and you're worried about that re-evaluate your education goals.

She's not the worst teacher, but you may be able to find better. She's very friendly, and show a lot of interesting videos. I am enjoying her class but you will have to read the chapters some to be prepared for quizzes and test. The quizzes are open notes and book, and she does review days for the test if you want the extra help with understanding.
